meanings.sent2: She deinstitutionalized her friend from the psychiatric ward after their treatment was complete.
meanings.sent3: The doctor deinstitutionalized the teddy bear from the toy hospital, declaring it fully recovered.
meanings.sent4: After years of confinement, the bird was deinstitutionalized from its cage and set free to soar.
meanings.sent5: The magician deinstitutionalized the rabbit from the hat, surprising the audience with its disappearance.

meanings.definition: To remove from an institution or organization.
meanings.sent1: The company deinstitutionalized the employee due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent2: He deinstitutionalized himself from the toxic workplace by resigning.
meanings.sent3: The chef deinstitutionalized the burnt dish from the menu, avoiding customer complaints.
meanings.sent4: The rescue team deinstitutionalized the trapped hiker from the mountain, bringing them to safety.
meanings.sent5: The teacher deinstitutionalized the disruptive student from the classroom, restoring peace for the others.
